H0.text: Which semi-aquatic carnivorous mammal of the weasel family has only two living species: the American and the European. Otter

H1.text: Which semi-aquatic carnivorous mammal of the weasel family has only two living species: the American and the European. Ferret

H2.text: Which semi-aquatic carnivorous mammal of the weasel family has only two living species: the American and the European. Badger

H3.text: Which semi-aquatic carnivorous mammal of the weasel family has only two living species: the American and the European. Mink

A4.text: The 14 extant otter species are all semiaquatic, both freshwater and marine.

A5.text: Photos and videos of the marine otter (Lontra felina), sea otter (Enhydra lutris), smooth-coated otter (Lutrogale perspicillata) and giant otter (Pteronura brasiliensis) are available.

A6.text: Photos and videos of Eurasian otters are available.

A7.text: The extinct Japanese otter is sometimes considered a subspecies; recent studies have found it to fall outside the subspecific clades comprising L. lutra, so it has been reclassified as a distinct species, but uncertainty remains.

A8.text: The black-footed ferret is entirely dependent on another keystone species, the prairie dog.

A9.text: The fisher, tayra, and martens are partially arboreal, while badgers are fossorial.

A10.text: Lutra species are semiaquatic mammals, so they are well-adapted to both water and land.

A11.text: Lutra is a genus of otters, one of seven in the subfamily Lutrinae.

A12.text: Lutra species are known to exhibit strong territorial behavior.

A14.text: Lontra is a genus of otters from the Americas.

A15.text: The genus comprises four living and one known fossil species.
